data.title: lunch was packed and yet service was excellent! Chef gave away fresh sushi samples!
data.text: I stopped by for lunch and found all food to be fresh. They are always busy. The wait staff was very polite and very helpful. The chef even greeted diners and treated everyone to fresh sushi samples. I was there in 2014 but that year was not an option by the time I finished this draft.

data.title: Best sushi in Tacoma!
data.text: I've been coming here for 28 years and it is truly the best in Tacoma. Fish is so fresh. Great menu of rolls and incredible sashimi. The staff is excellent including an amazing sushi chef Juan San. Favorite rolls are 69 and Chris roll. Must try.

data.title: Authentic, small, personal.
data.text: We have eaten here for years. We like this small restaurant for the good Japanese food, Sushi and personal service.  Typical the chef sends a sample to the table before the food we ordered is served.  They are willing to make small substitutions on the menu.  Other patrons enjoy the Sushi Bar, but it is not to our taste.

data.title: Tasty Food
data.text: Service was fast, friendly, and welcoming. Food was fresh, well-prepared and reasonable. I'd return!

data.title: Candy for the Eyes and Palate
data.text: We are never disappointed when we go to Fujiya for sushi.We usually sit at the sushi bar and watch the goodies "roll out." Started with cucumber salads Ebi-Su and Kani-Su (shrimp and crab respectively) on delicately sliced marinated cucumbers with beautiful garnishes. Candy for the eyes and palate. Check out the pictures. We had decided on spider maki, vegetable maki and a J-roll, when the server suggested two rolls not on the printed menu - Katana maki and Negihama maki - and went for it! They were incredible! Very tasty fresh fish, spicy tuna, and one topped with caviar.

data.title: Very high quality, non-presumptuous too.
data.text: Atmosphere was casual and inviting.  The entrance is not at street level.  When you walk in the door the first thing you smell is seasoned rice.  The dinner salad was a little weird, but the sushi was so tasty, with generous portions too.  This was the sushi experience I was hoping for while visiting the northwest coast.

data.title: Fabulous restaurant- best sushi in Tacoma
data.text: The best place for amazing sushi and Japanese cuisine. This restaurant has been here since 1984. Amazing owner and staff. Juan San is great sushi chef. Must try!

data.title: Try something new
data.text: As a sushi novice I wanted to experience several tastes. So our party of two ordered the Makasushi plate and requested diversity among the chef choice rolls. To our surprise we were provided four premium rolls across the two plates and a regular and white tuna roll. Very good service and special treats accompanied our meals. Perfect way to try new tastes.

data.title: Great Sushi and Oysters
data.text: Loved the sushi but loved the breaded oysters even more. The wait staff were awesome and very accommodating. They brought us additional food just because. We were treated very well. Brought a free round of saki which was enjoyed by our drinkers. Oh, did I say they oysters were great?

data.title: Good experience!
data.text: Went on New Years Eve before First Night...no reservations but glad we sat at the sushi bar. Chef Juan was dishing out samples (spicy tuna, mushroom salad). We split California roll, gyoza, seaweed salad and had plenty of food at reasonable prices. Jenna, our server was very attentive. This restaurant has been here for 30+ years so they must be doing something right...will definitely be back.

data.title: Favorite Japanese Restaurant!
data.text:
We like sitting at the sushi bar to watch the action. It's amazing how the chefs manage to work so efficiently in a small space.

Been here many times. On last visit, my chicken katsu meal included miso soup, salad, rice, and also a side of vegetables (beans, bamboo shoots, and beans.) Generous portion of food! 

Masahiro Endo's restaurant has been serving excellent food since 1984. A sign that he's got things right!

The restaurant is NOT on street level. It's up the stairs from Broadway between 11th and 13th St.

data.title: worst place ever
data.text: went there with a group of friends for the first time and the service was terrible and the food was terrible too. no one in our group like the food. the waitress was very slow with getting to us and she mixed up everyone's orders. She was also very rude to us when we mention how we were being treated and she even told us to never come back. I never been to such a horrible establishment in my life. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND NEVER GO THERE!!!!!!

data.title: I wanted to ❤️ but just liked
data.text:
My husband and I went for dinner. Other than the ramen it was tasty. 

Atmosphere: relaxing, bonus points for BGM from the 80's and early 90's. 

Service: fantastic 

Sushi: maki and sushi were fresh and delicious 

Ramen: broth suffering from sodium overload, I'm sure the noodles were good, but the broth was so salty that is the only thing that I remember. 

Gyoza: had pan-fried. Yum!

data.title: So Good We Ate There Twice
data.text: During our stay in Tacoma, we were looking for a sushi place close to our hotel.  Based on those criteria, we walked over to Fujiya.  What a lucky break.  The sushi is really delicious.  Our server directed us to his favorite rolls and also suggested several specials that were especially great.  The Kitana roll was the highlight, but everything was good.  We also tried salmon, mackerel and tuna nigiri and they were all delicious.  We liked our dinner so much that we came back again the next night.  Service was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient.  Also, they gave us several free bites, including different types of tempura and a noodle dish.  We would highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Consistently great.
data.text: Even after 20 years this old Tacoma landmark is consistently great.  Fresh food and great service and awesome presentation.

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: We visited on a Monday night, when the concierge at our hotel said we were not likely to find a good place for sushi open.  The wait staff was friendly and helpful during our first adventure sampling sushi. The chef even sent out an extra plate to taste.  This place seems hidden off the beaten track but really was in central downtown about a block from our hotel.  Go there!

data.title: Sushi Bliss at Fujiya
data.text: My need for a fresh sushi and lighter-than-air tempura takes me to downtown Tacoma several times a year, and it's definitely worth the trip!  If there is a seat available at the bar, take it -- you can watch the skilled chefs assemble your sushi before your eyes.  Lunch can be a real adventure, as the sushi and sashimi are

data.title: Our favorite place  in downtown Tacoma
data.text: Is a small place  but perfect  if you like good  services, the  staff  is really  nice and the  food  taste  amazing.

data.title: Slow and Easy
data.text: While the food is delicious and impeccable - the service is sometimes slow and agonizing - but the food is well worth the wait.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: The sushi was fresh and very good. The other dishes were average. Service was very good and friendly.
